#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Define Yourself
#Text=Everyone struggles to figure out who people truly are .
#Text=Often when they define themselves they focus on the negative or how they compare to other people .
#Text=Nobody but you can define who you are but this article has some tips on how to look at the ways you define yourself and how to make it positive .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Discovering Your Identity
#Text=Know yourself .
#Text=Self-knowledge , particularly non-judgemental self knowledge , is an incredibly important skill to help you define yourself .
#Text=You 'll need to understand what makes you tick and what your thought processes are before you can define who you are as a person .
#Text=Mindfulness means paying attention to what you are thinking and observing your patterns of thought .
#Text=For instance , you might realize that you have a tendency to feel that people do n't care what you think and that your opinions are unimportant .
#Text=Recognizing that you have these thoughts and catching them before they start causing you anxiety , can help you piece together the important parts of your identity .
#Text=When you start paying attention to your thought processes and patterns you 'll need to practice attentive non-judgment .
#Text=This means being aware of your thought patterns and acknowledging them , but not beating yourself up over them .
#Text=Everyone has negative thought patterns and processes .
#Text=By paying attention to them , you can eliminate them from your mind .
#Text=Notice how you identify yourself .
#Text=Once you start paying attention to the way you think about yourself and about the world , look specifically for the ways in which you identify yourself .
#Text=See what groups and communities you use to create your identity .
#Text=All of these inform how you see yourself and tell you what you are letting define you .
#Text=For example , look at things like religion , nationality , sexual identity and see if those are ways you define yourself .
#Text=Look at the roles you take on , such as your job , your position in your family ( mother , father , sister , brother ) , your romantic status ( single , couple , etc. ) .
#Text=Jot down thought processes and self definitions .
#Text=To become adept at seeing your thought processes and definitions and how those determine how you act and who you are , write them down in a notebook as you identify them .
#Text=You 'll be able to see how you consider yourself and it will make it easier to eliminate the negative associations .
#Text=Talking to and working with a clinical psychologist can greatly help in uncovering patterns of thinking and being .
#Text=They can also help you deal with the more negative aspects of your thinking .
#Text=Creating Your Self-Definition
#Text=Record your negative definitions .
#Text=Recording them and paying attention to them will help you let go of them .
#Text=Getting them out in the open can help to take away some of their hold on your mind and self .
#Text=Do n't limit yourself in negative ways .
#Text=Definition of the self determines the action .
#Text=So , for instance , if you 're defining yourself as someone who has bad romantic relationships , you 've already lost the potential for a good romantic relationship .
#Text=It is a story that you tell yourself , and then because you believe the story , you will already be behaving in ways that make the story true .
#Text=Identify your core values .
#Text=You do n't want to define yourself based on outside forces , because outside forces are volatile and subject to constant change .
#Text=By basing your self-definition on core values , you will have a better chance of having a stable self-definition .
#Text=You wo n't lose your self identity if you base it on values you hold at your core , like compassion , courage , integrity .
#Text=Write down a list of these values and consciously and mindfully act them out in your daily life .
#Text=Therefore , if courage is one of your core values , stand up for someone being harassed at the bus stop , or if honesty is a core value , fess up to having lost your father 's favorite watch .
#Text=If compassion is on that list , spend time volunteering at a homeless shelter .
#Text=Define yourself in positive ways .
#Text=This does n't mean that you do n't acknowledge the negative events and actions that have happened in your life .
#Text=They are as much a part of you as the positive , but they do not define you .
#Text=This means do n't let outside circumstances rule your identity .
#Text=That comes from within in , from the core values that you have already identified as being important to your identity .
#Text=Understand that the negative experiences in your life have offered knowledge .
#Text=For example , if you have had negative experiences with romance , learn from those experiences .
#Text=What have they taught you about the kind of person you want to be ?
#Text=Tips
#Text=Never ever forget that no one but you can define you .
#Text=You will always be the only one who can decide who you really are .
#Text=Be honest with yourself , but do n't be overly critical .
#Text=This means do n't say to yourself :
#Text=" I 'm ugly , " or " I 'm stupid .
